channel.title: NPR Topics: Culture
channel.description: Art and entertainment commentary plus interviews, book reviews, movie reviews, music reviews, comedy, and visual art. Subscribe to podcasts and follow trends in music, painting, art, architecture, photography, and design.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Here to Help: Thanksgiving Edition
item.description: From building homes to filling pantries to re-enacting medieval history for middle-schoolers – yes, you read that right – acts of volunteerism have remained vital for communities across the country.
item.content:encoded: From building homes to filling pantries to re-enacting medieval history for middle-schoolers – yes, you read that right – acts of volunteerism have remained vital for communities across the country.
item.dc:creator: Matt Ozug

item.title: It's not easy to get a Thanksgiving turkey in Moscow, Russia. But it's possible
item.description: Thanksgiving is of course a very American holiday. What, though, is an American overseas at this time of year to do — specially when it comes to eating turkey?
item.content:encoded: Thanksgiving is of course a very American holiday. What, though, is an American overseas at this time of year to do — specially when it comes to eating turkey?
item.dc:creator: Charles Maynes

item.title: Writer Suleika Jaouad shares how she stays connected to people she's lost
item.description: On Wild Card, well-known guests answer the kinds of questions we often think about but don't talk about. Writer Suleika Jaouad talks about how she stays connected to people she's lost.
item.content:encoded: On Wild Card, well-known guests answer the kinds of questions we often think about but don't talk about. Writer Suleika Jaouad talks about how she stays connected to people she's lost.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Martin

item.title: Soleil, a Belgian sheepdog, takes Best in Show at the National Dog Show
item.description: The National Dog Show, televised annually on Thanksgiving Day, is a beloved tradition for many families. This year, Soleil, a Belgian sheepdog, was crowned Best in Show.
item.content:encoded:
The National Dog Show, televised annually on Thanksgiving Day, is a beloved tradition for many families. This year, Soleil, a Belgian sheepdog, was crowned Best in Show.

(Image credit: National Dog Show)
item.dc:creator: Jackie Northam

item.title: NASA astronauts celebrate Thanksgiving with Russian cranberry sauce
item.description: NASA has made sure that the International Space Station is well stocked for a Thanksgiving meal full of treats. Here's what's on the menu.
item.content:encoded:
NASA has made sure that the International Space Station is well stocked for a Thanksgiving meal full of treats. Here's what's on the menu.

(Image credit: NASA webcast)
item.dc:creator: Nell Greenfieldboyce

item.title: Heading to the movies this Thanksgiving? Here's what's new
item.description: In addition to hits already in theaters like Wicked: For Good, this holiday week brings sequels for Zootopia and Knives Out.
item.content:encoded:
In addition to hits already in theaters like Wicked: For Good, this holiday week brings sequels for Zootopia and Knives Out.

(Image credit: Disney)
item.dc:creator: Bob Mondello

item.title: In 1981, Stephen Sondheim's 'Merrily' was a flop -- now it's a hit
item.description: A filmed version of the live production of Merrily We Roll Along will open in theaters on Dec. 5. We listen back to a 2024 interview with revival director Maria Friedman and actor Jonathan Groff.
item.content:encoded: A filmed version of the live production of Merrily We Roll Along will open in theaters on Dec. 5. We listen back to a 2024 interview with revival director Maria Friedman and actor Jonathan Groff.
item.dc:creator: Terry Gross

item.title: This artist designs intricate suits of armor. The intended wearer? A humble mouse
item.description: Jeff de Boer has made an entire career out of crafting tiny plate armor. He's compelled by the idea of the underdog finding an edge; something so small being so well-protected.
item.content:encoded:
Jeff de Boer has made an entire career out of crafting tiny plate armor. He's compelled by the idea of the underdog finding an edge; something so small being so well-protected.

(Image credit: Chona Kasinger)
item.dc:creator: Deena Prichep

item.title: An Ecuadorian-style Thanksgiving: Recreating holiday memories of a childhood recipe
item.description: Chef Rick Martinez, a James Beard award winner, helped an NPR host recreate a beloved Ecuadorian dish his family ate during Thanksgiving. Here's the recipe.
item.content:encoded:
Chef Rick Martinez, a James Beard award winner, helped an NPR host recreate a beloved Ecuadorian dish his family ate during Thanksgiving. Here's the recipe.

(Image credit: A Martinez)
item.dc:creator: Barry Gordemer

item.title: 'Stranger Things' is back. Does everything old still feel new?
item.description: The first episodes of the show's fifth and final season are out on Wednesday night. Critic Eric Deggans says the Duffer Brothers keep the plot moving along — even though, so far, many of the storylines feel familiar.
item.content:encoded:
The first episodes of the show's fifth and final season are out on Wednesday night. Critic Eric Deggans says the Duffer Brothers keep the plot moving along — even though, so far, many of the storylines feel familiar.

(Image credit: Netflix)
item.dc:creator: Eric Deggans
